headline: Ancient + Brave
full_text:
Ancient + Brave
AD | I do love a protein powder, they are so useful to top up your protein intake in a busy world. So I am excited that one of my favourites, @ancientandbrave, has brought out their Brave Ancestral Protein - and it does not disappoint. It’s grass-fed bovine isolate, really supportive for muscle mass, genuinely convenient, and actually tastes great. It goes beyond ‘just protein’– there are digestive enzymes for gut support, ingredients that help the nervous system, metabolic health and glucose control. It’s one of those products that just fits into real life - busy days, training days, every day. As with anything health-related, consistency is key. Having it on subscription makes sense to me and keeps things simple. Safe to say, I’m slightly obsessed – and very glad it’s now part of the Ancient + Brave line-up. #braveancestralprotein #ancientandbrave

video_analysis_json.transcript: I often get asked what I think about protein powder. And what I think about protein powder is that it is really useful. But they are not all created equal. A lot are full of fillers and sweeteners and gums, which is why I am so thrilled that Ancient and Brave have brought out their Brave Ancestral Protein. They have used both find isolate, which is just brilliant for helping support muscle mass. And all the building blocks of the body. They have also used botanicals to support metabolic health, digestion, nervous system. So there are things like cacao, beetroot, carob, cinnamon, green kiwi fruit. They've also used methylated B vitamins. I was lucky enough to take part in the 14-day inner circle trial. And I can honestly say that after a few weeks of taking the protein powder every day, my energy levels did feel more stable. I love it. Give it a go.

angle: Quiet bravery for women's deferred dreams
headline: Ancient + Brave
full_text:
Ancient + Brave
Right. Let’s talk bravery. Not the shouty, chest beating kind. The quieter version. The one where you sit there thinking, “I’d love to do that… but I probably can’t right now.” @ancientandbrave have been working closely with the Bluetit 6 @bluetit6.channelrelayteam2027 a group of amazing women training to swim the English Channel together. Watching their journey makes one thing very clear. Ordinary women, when properly supported, do extraordinary things. No drama. No ego. Just turning up and getting it done. That’s why I’m proud to be involved with ‘The Endeavour’. A bravery initiative created to unlock the challenges and adventures women have been carrying in their minds for years. The thing that keeps getting pushed down the list because life, money, confidence or something else gets in the way. This isn’t about being extreme or fearless. It’s about doing something that’s personally challenging Something that helps you explore what you’re capable of Four women or groups of women will join the Bluetits 6 and receive up to £20,000, plus expert nutritional guidance, a product supply and support from an Ancient + Brave community who will have their back from start to finish. I’ll be on the judging panel with @davinamccall and Ancient + Brave Founder, Kate Prince, searching for the most inspiring dreams out there and motivating the selected participants on their epic journeys. I’m also quietly hoping the Bluetits 6 might help me turn my sea bobbing into actual sea swimming at some point. No pressure! If there’s something you, your friends or loved ones have been thinking about for years but never got started, this might be the moment. Applications are open now. See link in bio #theendeavour #ancientandbrave
hook_phrase: Right. Let's talk bravery. Not the shouty, chest beating kind. The quieter version.

video_analysis_json.transcript: I'm so excited to tell you about The Endeavour from Ancient + Brave. We're on a nationwide search for individuals or groups of women with a dream adventure that's meaningful, challenging and inspiring to others. Your chance to finally do the thing you've always wanted to do, but life just got in the way. The selected few, they'll receive funding to bring it to life. Plus personalised nutritional support from Ancient + Brave to fuel training, mindset and courage. So, is this the year you say "yes"? Check the application criteria and apply at the link. Go on, unlock your brave adventure.

image_analysis_json.focal_point: The question 'Can creatine make me look bulky/puffy?' and the muscular arm.
on_screen_text: Can creatine make me look bulky/puffy?

What some people may experience is a little water retention in their muscles. Creatine draws water into your muscle cells, increasing their hydration and therefore improving their function and recovery (even muscles get thirsty!). It's important to note that the water retention associated with creatine is stored within your muscles, not under your skin. This means you won't look bloated or "puffy" from taking creatine, however some notice their muscles appearing more defined.
Support your energy, strength & cognition with True Creatine+

headline: Apply Now to The Endeavour
full_text:
Apply Now to The Endeavour
Every woman has an adventure quietly waiting inside her. 🖤 We created the Endeavour to help more women unlock their dreams and to find out what they’re really capable of. We’re looking for women who want to do something of personal significance. It should be: + Something difficult for you: This will be your Everest. You won’t be able to guarantee your success but the attempt alone will be worth it. + Important to you: You can articulate a reason for doing this beyond hobby.It will prove something to you, move you forward positively or help you find new possibilities within yourself + Inspiring to others: Your story is one that we are inspired by and that we believe will inspire other brave women to explore what they’re capable of. It is not the average endeavour but an extraordinary one. What matters is personal significance. The courage relative to the individual. Four women or groups of women will receive up to £20,000 in funding, alongside expert guidance, nutritional support and a community that has their back. Applications are now open to women across the UK, and they will be judged by a panel including Davina McCall, Joe Marler and Kate Prince.

video_analysis_json.transcript: Big changes don't always come from big actions. Sometimes the smallest micro habits make the biggest impact. For so long, I focused on training, the workouts, the movement, pushing harder, but I didn't really prioritize recovery. And between traveling, gym sessions, sauna time, and just life, I'd often end up feeling drained and dehydrated without even realizing. So I started adding Ancient + Brave's True Hydration into my routine. And honestly, it's been one of those small shifts that just fits. It has prebiotic fibre to support the gut microbiome, which I love because it feels like it's doing more than just quenching my thirst. It slots right into my morning, especially after a workout, and actually works within my lifestyle, rather than feeling like another chore. Plus it has added chromium which contributes to the normal maintenance of blood glucose levels and nutrient metabolism. And the bonus, it hydrates the skin from within, which is a win in my books. Sometimes it's a tiny consistent micro habits that end up making the big difference. You can take the quiz to find the products that are right for you and for your life goals.

headline: Subscribe and Save 20% On First Three Orders
full_text:
Subscribe and Save 20% On First Three Orders
#ad I haven’t taken protein powders in years, even though I train a lot. But most days the real lifting isn’t in the gym, it’s life. I’m a mum of three girls, juggling work and travelling between Wales and London every week. It’s a lot, physically and mentally. My husband and I have tried plenty of options over the years, but some weren’t easy to digest, so I never stuck with it, even though I know protein matters when you’re asking this much of your body. @ancientandbrave has long been part of my daily rituals, so being invited into their Inner Circle to try the new Brave Ancestral Protein just felt right. I’m happy to report it tastes indulgent, with no added flavours or sweetners, and feels gentle, so it’s easy to digest. I’ve felt less depleted and less frazzled on the kind of days that usually wipe me out. I’ve shared on my stories a couple of very easy ways to integrate it into your daily routine. Enjoy!
hook_phrase: I haven't taken protein powders in years, even though I train a lot. But most days the real lifting isn't in the gym, it's life.

video_analysis_json.transcript: I always share bits of my days with you and this is honestly what most of them look like. I try to get to the gym and I've started lifting weights but most of what I lift is mental, working, planning, juggling projects, family life, going back and forth between Wales and London. It's actually quite a lot and in my 40s now I can't afford to run on empty. My husband and I have tried loads of protein powders over the years but I never really found one that suited me, so I stopped. Ancient + Brave were already part of my daily rituals so when I was invited into their inner circle trial I was just curious. And this one really does feel different. The taste matters, it's easy to digest and I can have it in a smoothie or with almond milk and when I'm at home it's basically this and coffee on repeat. Looking after my energy is part of how I design my life now and this has been such an easy addition.
